Activity: Log in to the system and check emails. Scan for urgent messages and flag anything related to the EHR project.

Brainstorming session: Review the existing EHR system documentation to identify modules relevant to influenza data collection (e.g., immunization records, lab results, patient history). I will create a preliminary list of EHR functionalities that could be leveraged or need modification.

Deep dive into the EHR system. Specifically, examine the data fields available for influenza vaccinations, diagnostic codes (ICD-10), and relevant patient demographics. I will jot down any limitations or gaps in the existing data capture capabilities.
Lunch Break - Quick bite in the cafeteria, maybe catch up on some industry news online.

Contact @clinlead-1 and @his-1 for a brief informational interview. Ask for their insights on the clinical perspective of influenza data collection, workflow challenges, and desired data elements for seasonal trend analysis. Document their feedback.

Based on my research and feedback from @clinlead-1 and @his-1, I will refine the list of required EHR system modifications needed to facilitate robust influenza data collection. This will be the basis of communication with the EHR vendor.

Draft an initial email to the EHR vendor introducing myself as the primary contact for this project at the hospital and state the project goals - enhancing EHR data collection for influenza and supporting seasonal trend analysis. Schedule a meeting for later in the week to discuss project requirements.
Review the meeting agenda for the upcoming meeting with the EHR vendor. Ensure all points I want to discuss are clearly noted. Prepare for tomorrow.
